Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: rim black, streaky on underside; at top of wall, on a low fascia, band of ovolos with black dot in centres between lines; below, red-figure laurel to left; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The modern inscription 'Diox' on the side break of the sherd signifies the sherd's provenance as having come from the Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi, despite the dedication to Apollo.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 856, pl. XXII, no. 856)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 693, no. 504)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0191) (Phase 1)
